explanation: The report is correct in substance: there is a potential out‑of‑bounds write via memcpy in init_response_body_data which violates MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17. In init_response_body_data the code mallocs body_dyn of size body_dyn_size and then unconditionally does memcpy(body_dyn + pos, body_header, MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_(body_header)). If body_dyn_size < MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_(body_header) that memcpy will write past the end of the allocated buffer. The subsequent loop also does an unsigned subtraction (body_dyn_size - (header_len + footer_len)) which will underflow when header_len+footer_len > body_dyn_size, producing a very large loop bound and further out‑of‑bounds accesses. Note that the offending calls are in init_response_body_data (the shown create_response_object uses body_dyn and body_dyn_size but does not itself perform the copies). To fix: validate that body_dyn_size is at least header_len + footer_len (and compute bounds using signed/checked arithmetic or explicit comparisons) before performing memcpy or filling the buffer, or limit the copy sizes to the available buffer length.
